abstract: Study involving a group of people diagnosed with schizophrenia is showing researchers how the disorder can be managed while people build full, successful lives;  study was a joint project of University of California, Los Angeles, University of Southern California and Veterans Affairs Department; findings are forcing researchers to discard some assumptions about the disease. (Series: Lives Restored)
snippet: After years of mental turmoil, Keris Myrick learned that she needed a high-profile position, not a low-key one, to manage her symptoms — among the discoveries that have challenged researchers’ assumptions.
lead_paragraph: After years of mental turmoil, Keris Myrick learned that she needed a high-profile position, not a low-key one, to manage her symptoms — among the discoveries that have challenged researchers’ assumptions.
